Key Match Events: Ismaila Sarr converted a penalty in the 71st minute to break the deadlock and secure a 1-0 win for Senegal.
Pre-Game Insights: Senegal were frustrated by an opening draw at home to Burkina Faso last Friday – in which they conceded a last-gasp equaliser.
Post-Match Reflections: Senegal bossed the first half, but found Burundi’s defence a resilient one.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The teams will return to Group L action next month, with Burundi and Senegal facing respective double-headers against Burkina Faso and Malawi respectively.
Others: Senegal claimed their first win in Group L of the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON) qualifiers.
